intro: Cymopterus purpureus, commonly known as the purple evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the tribe Physaleae within the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are usually unbranched and hairy. The flowers produce small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation.
